alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 6:34PM CDT until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... NB Chicago River at Chicago (Grand Ave) affecting Cook County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...NB Chicago River from Confluence with the North Shore Channel downstream to Summit, including the Chicago (Grand Ave) gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, Numerous stretches of the Chicago Riverwalk are inundated. At 3.5 feet, Commercial areas of the Chicago Riverwalk are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 2.2 feet. - Forecast...The river briefly crested near 3.4 feet and then fell due to reversal of the Chicago River at Chicago Lock. The river is expected to remain between 2 and 3 feet over the next several hours before slowly falling this evening. - Flood stage is 3.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Monday afternoon.
